data.meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".
data.sentence: The word نَشَأْ comes from the root ش ي ا and is associated with the meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".

data.meanings: sank, drowned, went downwards and disappeared, became without need, drew the bow to the full (with vehement fulling), outstripped, engrossed, a man overwhelmed by trials, single draught, ornamented, obligatory
data.sentence: The word نُغْرِقْهُمْ comes from the root غ ر ق and is associated with the meanings: sank, drowned, went downwards and disappeared, became without need, drew the bow to the full (with vehement fulling), outstripped, engrossed, a man overwhelmed by trials, single draught, ornamented, obligatory

data.meanings: to cry out loudly, cry/implore for help/assistance, shout for succour.
data.sentence: The word صَرِيخَ comes from the root ص ر خ and is associated with the meanings: to cry out loudly, cry/implore for help/assistance, shout for succour.
The word يُنْقَذُونَ comes from the root ن ق ذ and is associated with the meanings: (Nun-Qaf-Thal) to liberate, rescue, deliver.
